001/*

005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.CollectionUtil;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
010
011import java.io.IOException;
012import java.net.URI;
013import java.util.ArrayList;
014import java.util.Collection;
015import java.util.Collections;
016import java.util.Deque;
017import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
018import java.util.List;
019import java.util.Map;
020
021import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
022
023/**
024 * Provides methods to load a Metaschema expressed in XML.
025 * <p>
026 * Loaded Metaschema instances are cached to avoid the need to load them for
027 * every use. Any Metaschema imported is also loaded and cached automatically.
028 *
029 * @param <T>
030 *          the Java type of the module binding
031 * @param <M>
032 *          the Java type of the Metaschema module loaded by this loader
033 */
034public abstract class AbstractModuleLoader<T, M extends IModuleExtended<M, ?, ?, ?, ?>>
035    extends AbstractLoader<M>
036    implements IModuleLoader<M> {
037  @NonNull
038  private final List<IModuleLoader.IModulePostProcessor> modulePostProcessors;
039
040  /**
041   * Construct a new Metaschema module loader, which use the provided module post
042   * processors when loading a module.
043   *
044   * @param modulePostProcessors
045   *          post processors to perform additional module customization when
046   *          loading
047   */
048  protected AbstractModuleLoader(@NonNull List<IModuleLoader.IModulePostProcessor> modulePostProcessors) {
049    this.modulePostProcessors = CollectionUtil.unmodifiableList(new ArrayList<>(modulePostProcessors));
050  }
051
052  /**
053   * Get the set of module post processors associated with this loader.
054   *
055   * @return the set of constraints
056   */
057  @NonNull
058  protected List<IModuleLoader.IModulePostProcessor> getModulePostProcessors() {
059    return modulePostProcessors;
060  }
061
062  /**
063   * Parse the {@code resource} based on the provided {@code xmlObject}.
064   *
065   * @param resource
066   *          the URI of the resource being parsed
067   * @param binding
068   *          the XML beans object to parse
069   * @param importedModules
070   *          previously parsed Metaschema modules imported by the provided
071   *          {@code resource}
072   * @return the parsed resource as a Metaschema module
073   * @throws MetaschemaException
074   *           if an error occurred while parsing the XML beans object
075   */
076  @NonNull
077  protected abstract M newModule(
078      @NonNull URI resource,
079      @NonNull T binding,
080      @NonNull List<? extends M> importedModules) throws MetaschemaException;
081
082  /**
083   * Get the list of Metaschema module URIs associated with the provided binding.
084   *
085   * @param binding
086   *          the Metaschema module binding declaring the imports
087   * @return the list of Metaschema module URIs
088   */
089  @NonNull
090  protected abstract List<URI> getImports(@NonNull T binding);
091
092  @Override
093  protected M parseResource(@NonNull URI resource, @NonNull Deque<URI> visitedResources)
094      throws IOException {
095    // parse this Metaschema module
096    T binding = parseModule(resource);
097
098    // now check if this Metaschema imports other metaschema
099    List<URI> imports = getImports(binding);
100    @NonNull Map<URI, M> importedModules;
101    if (imports.isEmpty()) {
102      importedModules = ObjectUtils.notNull(Collections.emptyMap());
103    } else {
104      try {
105        importedModules = new LinkedHashMap<>();
106        for (URI importedResource : imports) {
107          URI resolvedResource = ObjectUtils.notNull(resource.resolve(importedResource));
108          importedModules.put(resolvedResource, loadInternal(resolvedResource, visitedResources));
109        }
110      } catch (MetaschemaException ex) {
111        throw new IOException(ex);
112      }
113    }
114
115    // now create this metaschema
116    Collection<M> values = importedModules.values();
117    try {
118      M module = newModule(resource, binding, new ArrayList<>(values));
119
120      for (IModuleLoader.IModulePostProcessor postProcessor : getModulePostProcessors()) {
121        postProcessor.processModule(module);
122      }
123      return module;
124    } catch (MetaschemaException ex) {
125      throw new IOException(ex);
126    }
127  }
128
129  /**
130   * Parse the provided XML resource as a Metaschema module.
131   *
132   * @param resource
133   *          the resource to parse
134   * @return the XMLBeans representation of the Metaschema module
135   * @throws IOException
136   *           if a parsing error occurred
137   */
138  @NonNull
139  protected abstract T parseModule(@NonNull URI resource) throws IOException;
140}
